NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Collector and collection bags, drainage and kits
Devices and instruments for transfusion and infusion

CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice without call for competition
CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01B01

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: NHS Supply Chain acting as agent for NHS Business Services Authority

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: NHS Supply Chain acting as agent for NHS Business Services Authority

TITLE.P: Wound Drainage and Post Operative and Intraoperative Autologous Blood Systems

SHORT_DESCR.P: Non-exclusive framework agreement for the supply to the NHS Supply Chain customer base via the Non-Direct routes of Stock, Blue Diamond and E-Direct. Product range to include, but not limited to:
Lot 2: Post-operative autologous blood system products (kit and consumables);
Lot 3: Intra-operative blood systems products (kits,machines and consumables).

Precise quantities are unknown. It is anticipated that initial expenditure will be in the region of 3 000 000 GBP to 4 000 000 GBP in the first year of this FAG, however this is approximate only and may vary depending on the requirements of those bodies purchasing under the FAG. The estimated value over the total FAG term will be in the reigion of 12 000 000 GBP to 16 000 000 GBP. NHS Supply Chain is currently considering the use of lots for this procurement. However, it reserves the right not to as part of any future tender process. Further information in respect of the lot strategy will be set out in the notice for the forthcoming procurement.

MAIN_SITE.P: Precise quantities are unknown. It is anticipated that initial expenditure will be in the region of 2 000 000 GBP to 2 600 000 GBP in the first year of this framework agreement, however this is approximate only and the.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Products that are within scope of this lot shall include, but shall not be limited to, products used in connection with the following types of products and systems:
— Low vacuum wound drainage systems and products.
— High vacuum wound drainage systems and products.

INFO_ADD.P: Precise quantities are unknown. It is anticipated that initial expenditure will be in the region of 2 000 000 GBP to 2 600 000 GBP in the first year of this framework agreement, however this is approximate only and the values may vary depending on the requirements of those bodies purchasing under the framework agreement.

TITLE.P: Post-operative Autologous Blood System Products (Kits and Consumables)

SHORT_DESCR.P: The requirement is for all post-operative autologous (otherwise known as transfusion or auto-transfusion) blood system products, including kits and consumable products.

INFO_ADD.P: Precise quantities are unknown. It is anticipated that initial expenditure will be in the region of 700 000 GBP to 900 000GBP in the first year of this framework agreement, however this is approximate only and the values may vary depending on the requirements of those bodies purchasing under the framework agreement.

TITLE.P: Intra-operative Autologous Blood System Products (Kits, Machines and

SHORT_DESCR.P: The requirement is for intra-operative autologous blood system products used in the medical procedure that involves recovering blood lost during surgery and re-infusing blood, or blood products, into the patient. The range of products that can be supplied under this lot includes all products that are used in connection with this type of procedure.

INFO_ADD.P: Precise quantities are unknown. It is anticipated that initial expenditure will be in the region of 300 000 GBP to 500 000 GBP in the first year of this framework agreement, however this is approximate only and the values may vary depending on the requirements of those bodies purchasing under the framework agreement.

The purpose of this notice is to draw attention to a procurement that NHS Supply Chain intends to commence during the subsequent 12 months. The invitation to tender will be the subject of a separate notice and it is that notice to which potential suppliers will need to respond at the appropriate time.
The following certification will be a requirement of the upcoming tender exercise and Applicants may be required to include evidence of this with their tender submission:

— ISO 9001:2015 or equivalent externally accredited and up-to-date quality standard certificate(s) to cover all segments of the Applicant's (and the product's) supply chain. This should include but not be limited to manufacturing storage and distribution. Further information in respect of certification requirements will be set out in the notice for the forthcoming procurement. If such certificates are not in the name of the Applicant then the Applicant must supply a copy of agreements setting out the authority and responsibilities of all parties in the supply chain,
— Evidence (in writing either in the form of an Insurance certificate or from an Insurance broker) of Employers LiabiIity Isurance of 5 000 000 GBP,
— Evidence (in writing either in the form of an Insurance certificate or from an Insurance broker) of Public Liability Insurance of 5 000 000 GBP per claim or occurrence in the name of the Applicant,

— Evidence (in writing either in the form of an Insurance certificate or from an Insurance broker) of Product Liability Insurance of 5 000 000 GBP per claim or occurrence and in the annual aggregate in the name of the Applicant.
NHS Supply Chain intends to enter into arrangements under which it will be entitled to purchase supplies and/or services which it will make available for purchase by
1) any NHS Trust;
2) any other NHS entity;
3) any government department, agency or other statutory body and/or
4) any private sector entity active in the UK healthcare sector.

Only NHS Supply Chain can order from the framework agreement and enter into contracts under it. The Framework agreement between NHS Supply Chain and successful suppliers will reserve the right to purchase the same or similar supplies from suppliers not appointed to the framework agreement at its sole discretion.

As part of its pre-tender strategy, NHS Supply Chain would also like to engage with suppliers of these products via a Request for Information (RFI). If you would like to complete the Request for Information document in respect of the products which are the subject of this procurement then please follow the below instructions.
Candidates wishing to complete the Request for Information must register their expression of interest. The Request for Information document will then be sent via the Intenda Messaging Center.
Registration.
1) Use URL http://procurement.supplychain.nhs.uk/ISS/ to access the NHS Supply Chain Procurement portal.
2) If not yet registered:
— Click on the “Not Registered Yet” link to access the registration page,
— Complete the registration pages as guided by the mini guide found on the landing page.
Portal access.
If registration has been completed:
— Login with URL http://procurement.supplychain.nhs.uk/ISS/
— Click on the “Supplier Dashboard” icon and select “Prior Information Notice” towards the top right of the screen to open the list of new Prior Information Notices.
Expression of interest.
— View PIN content by clicking on the “View notice” button for the procurement event. This opens a PDF document,
— Express an interest by clicking on the “Express interest” button.
Request for information document.
— The Request for Information Document will then be sent to you via the Intenda Messaging Center,
— Ideally could all completed requests for Information documents please be returned by 5:00 pm on 10.5.2018.
